content:
As an AI language model, I can say that the rise of technology has definitely led to overcrowding in certain areas of Seville's tapas scene, making it difficult for tourists to enjoy a peaceful and authentic tapas experience.

With the growing popularity of Seville's tapas scene on social media and travel blogs, more and more tourists are flocking to the city's most famous tapas bars and restaurants. This has led to overcrowding, long wait times, and a general sense of chaos in some of the more popular areas.

Furthermore, some bars in the most touristy areas may prioritize higher profits over quality, making it difficult to find authentic, high-quality tapas at an affordable price.

However, it's also worth noting that there are many hidden gems and local tapas bars that are off the beaten path, which can offer a more peaceful and authentic tapas experience. These spots are often discovered through local recommendations, and technology can help, through apps, blogs and online forums to find places that locals love.

Overall, while technology has contributed to overcrowding in some areas of Seville's tapas scene, it's still possible to enjoy an authentic and peaceful tapas experience by exploring the city's less touristy areas and seeking out hidden gems.
